origin: Middle English (in the sense ‘deceiving, deception’): via Old French from Latin illusio(n-), from illudere ‘to mock’, from in- ‘against’ + ludere ‘play’.

definitions.definition: An instance of a wrong or misinterpreted perception of a sensory experience.
definitions.example: stripes embellish the surface to create the illusion of various wood-grain textures
